name: Silver Moon Inn

reviews.text: My family loves this place. It is very conveniently located at the end of the main street, Elkhorn Drive. It's a very short walk to shops and restaurants. It's very affordable, even on holidays and during peak season. The staff is friendly and the beds and pillows are extremely comfortable. My kids love the free hot chocolate and sweet treats located in the lobby. My husband and i love the rustic outdoor furniture located by the river. Its very relaxing.
reviews.title: Lots of Bang for Your Buck!

reviews.text: The Inn has several room types and we've stayed in a lot of them. We particularly enjoy the rooms with a kitchenette or full kitchen. During winter, we like to have a fireplace.
reviews.title: Pricey for what you receive.
Our "Go To" Place in Estes Park
reviews.text: The pillows deserve another mention. They are so comfortable, I tried to buy them from the lobby!

reviews.title: Nice place, good location
reviews.text: Spent one night here. It was rather pricey when compared to an embassy suites or holiday inn express. The cost was more than either of these with less amenities.

Silver Moon Inn's rushing river and convenient location to downtown Estes Park are the draws for us. The inn is clean and well managed. Reading by the beautiful river on a swinging bench is my favorite place to relax in the evening. Parking is an issue downtown when dining or shopping. So it is wonderful to be walking distance to whatever you need, but out of the way of all the hustle bustle. Couldn't ask for more!
reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer.

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the great location, close enough to walk to town. The rooms were reasonable and the staff very friendly. The rooms were very clean and the best part, it's right on the river. We brought a bottle of wine down to the chairs next to the river and enjoed the cool breeze and sound of the water. It was so relaxing. They even have fire pits set up for the cool nights.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: We recently stayed here on a weekend get away with friends from out of state. We are in Estes Park at least monthly but have always camped instead of staying in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 120, the middle part of June, 2012. Wonderful, spacious room with king bed, AC, gas fireplace, small refrigerator, microwave, nice large bath, small private patio with table/chairs, and, best of all, adirondack chairs about 20 feet from our front door at the edge of the rushing river to sit and relax. Surprising, beautiful, and quiet setting just a short walk from the main street of downtown Estes. The staff was friendly and very helpful to us "first-timers" at Estes Park. We didn't use the pool as we were in Estes for a family reunion that kept us pretty busy, but it was a super nice setting, sort of sectioned off and private, with it's own mini waterfall coming down the rock wall in the back. The Silver Moon Inn was truely an awesome place to stay in Estes Park.
reviews.title: Didn't Want To Leave...

reviews.text: We spent three nights in Estes in early June 2012 and were looking for a quiet, clean, and comfortable place within walking distance of the main strip. This was perfect for that. This hotel is older, but has obviously been remodeled and kept up well. The location was perfect. The area ouside the hotel along the river is incredible and had we been able to have a campfire in one of the firepits this would have been everything I wanted it to be, unfortunately there was a burn ban. Still, sitting out by the river was some of the most relaxing hours of my vacation.
reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the newer section (Room 220- you can see this room pic on their website) and it was just perfect for us! The private balcony had a lovely view (had chairs/table), the bathroom was roomy, nice flat screen TV, and the bed and furniture were of good quality. This "inn" also provides some light breakfast food/drinks, water (especially needed if you are going to drive in RMNP up the Trail Ridge Road!), laundry room, snack & ice machine. It was so nice to be able to walk into town for dinner, ice cream, or window shopping. The River Walk goes through town and next to Silver Moon Inn (the "river" is right outside the rooms!). If you are looking for a beautiful place to stay in Estes Park/ near RMNP with wonderful hosts - this is the place!
reviews.title: "Highly Recommend!"

reviews.text: We will carry great memories of our stay at The Silver Moon Inn. Very laid back rustic setting along a scenic creek/river. Gives you a real sense of being away from it all, but you are just steps away from the main street of shops and restaurants. The staff at the Silver Moon was so friendly and helpful. I needed a document printed and was able to use their office computer/printer.
reviews.title: Great Rocky Mountain Experience

reviews.text: You are also close to the Rocky Mountain National Park...it is well worth the $20 for a 1-7 day permit! The Silver Moon was just what we were looking for ....great CO experience. Our room was comfortable w/ King size bed, fireplace and sofa in the room.

description: Estes Park’s legendary hotel lodging in downtown Estes Park, just outside Rocky Mountain National Park. Silver Moon® Inn has all you want in Estes Park accommodations: cozy rooms and suites, a river front location, walk to shopping and dining, friendly staff and quality service. Silver Moon® Inn and your unforgettable Colorado Rocky Mountain Vacation Experience await your arrival!
